actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Energy and Commerce.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Energy and Commerce
actions.text: Referred to Subcommittee on Telecommunications, Consumer Protection and Finance.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Telecommunications, Consumer Protection and Finance

official_title: A bill to direct the Federal Communications Commission to conduct an experiment to test the feasibility of extended broadcasting hours of operation for amplitude modulated broadcast stations which currently are licensed for daytime operation only.
short_title: Amplitude Modulated Broadcast Station Experiment Act of 1983

summary.text: Amplitude Modulated Broadcast Station Experiment Act of 1983 - Directs the Federal Communications Commission to: (1) conduct an experiment to test the feasibility of establishing extended broadcasting hours for amplitude modulated broadcast radio stations having only daytime operating licenses; and (2) report the results of the experiment to Congress.

titles.title: Amplitude Modulated Broadcast Station Experiment Act of 1983

A bill to direct the Federal Communications Commission to conduct an experiment to test the feasibility of extended broadcasting hours of operation for amplitude modulated broadcast stations which currently are licensed for daytime operation only.
